gsplot.style package

Submodules

gsplot.style.label module

class gsplot.style.label.AddIndexToAxes(axes)

Bases: object

A class used to add index to the axes of a plot.

…

_axes

a list of axes to which the index will be added

Type:

list

add_index():

Adds an index to each axis in the _axes attribute.

add_index()

Adds an index to each axis in the _axes attribute. The index is a letter from ‘a’ to ‘z’. The position of the index is determined by the bounding box of the axis.

class gsplot.style.label.Labels(lab_lims=None, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: object

A class used to manage labels and ticks on a plot.

…

_kwargs

a dictionary of keyword arguments passed to the class

Type:

dict

args

a tuple of positional arguments passed to the class

Type:

tuple

__axes

an instance of the _Axes class

Type:

_Axes

Example

>>> labels = Labels(
...     lab_lims=[
...         ["x_label1", "y_label1", ["x_min1", "x_max1"], ["y_min1", "y_max1"]],
...         ["x_label2", "y_label2", ["x_min2", "x_max2"], ["y_min2", "y_max2"]],
...         # Add more lists for more axes
...     ]
... )
>>> labels.main()  # Call the main method to apply the labels and limits to the axes
xticks(base=None, num_minor=None):

Sets the x-ticks on the current axis.

yticks(base=None, num_minor=None):

Sets the y-ticks on the current axis.

xlabels_off(axis):

Turns off x-labels on the given axis.

ylabels_off(axis):

Turns off y-labels on the given axis.

_ticks_all():

Adds minor ticks to all axes if minor_ticks_all is True.

_add_labels():

Adds labels to the axes based on the lab_lims attribute.

_tight_layout():

Adjusts the padding between and around the subplots.

_add_index():

Adds an index to each axis if add_index is True.

main():

Executes the main functionality of the class.

main()

Executes the main functionality of the class. This includes adding minor ticks, labels, adjusting layout, and adding index.

xlabels_off(axis)

Turns off x-labels on the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (Axes) – the axis on which to turn off x-labels

xticks(num_minor=None)

Sets the x-ticks on the current axis.

Parameters:

  • base (float, optional) – The base step between each major tick.

  • num_minor (int, optional) – The number of minor ticks between each pair of major ticks.

ylabels_off(axis)

Turns off y-labels on the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (Axes) – the axis on which to turn off y-labels

yticks(num_minor=None)

Sets the y-ticks on the current axis.

Parameters:

  • base (float, optional) – The base step between each major tick.

  • num_minor (int, optional) – The number of minor ticks between each pair of major ticks.

gsplot.style.ticks module

class gsplot.style.ticks.MinorTicks

Bases: object

A class used to manage the minor ticks on a plot’s axes.

…

__axes

a list of axes

Type:

list

minor_ticks_off(axis):

Turns off minor ticks on the given axis.

minor_ticks_on(axis):

Turns on minor ticks on the given axis.

minor_ticks_all():

Turns on minor ticks on all axes.

minor_ticks_all()

Turns on minor ticks on all axes.

Parameters:

None

minor_ticks_off(axis)

Turns off minor ticks on the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – The axis on which to turn off minor ticks.

minor_ticks_on(axis)

Turns on minor ticks on the given axis.

Parameters:

axis (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – The axis on which to turn on minor ticks.
